review: Chromecast was fairly simple to set up and use. The battery power drain on my ios device is extremely minimal when using. Also, I found it to work great from the Chrome browser on my MacBook Pro. The price is ridiculously competitive (why I decided against Apple TV). 4/5 only because the list of compatible apps is so minimal right now, can't wait to see more development on this device!
author: jf26

review: I have this connected through my Onkyo NR616, which is connected to my non-HDMI TV via an HDMI > DVI cable.  My cable box and Roku display just fine via this method.  The Chromecast does not.  I get the sound through my receiver, but no video.  As I have a Roku already, I bought this because of the low price and the novelty (and I thought the auto input switching would may for a better way to fire up Pandora from my phone).  So while it does work for that particular use case, with no video, it's really just a novelty at this point.  It's a slick package and a great idea and I hope there will be more content available when I replace my TV with one that can accept HDMI.
author: Eric

review: Expected it to work on all HDMI capable tvs but surprisingly a 3 year old Vizio wasnt having it. I tried both Vizio support and Google support. Neither group found a solution. Still give it 4 stars since it works like a charm on the other tvs. like others waiting patiently for true dlna support so i can stream from local computer.
author: jg amazon & tech addict

review: It's a useful product. It's been more than a month I've been using it. But initially, the set up was very hectic as the chromecast was not detected by my new Samsung LED TV. I had to reset it a lot and finally it got set up. So I haven't touched it or taken out ever since.
